creator: fmarzocca
title: UltraV: a Portable UV-index Meter
description: The UltraV is a portable ultraviolet (UV) rays meter built on an Arduino Nano. It uses an UV sensor, a DC/DC converter to raise the battery voltage, and a small OLED display to show the UV-index. The project aims to provide a portable way to measure UV-index in any location.
steps: Gather all the required components, including an Arduino Nano, ML8511 UV sensor, OLED display, DC-DC step-up converter, CR2 battery and holder, and enclosure case.
Connect the ML8511 UV sensor to the Arduino. The sensor converts photo-current to voltage depending on the UV intensity and has an easy interface to external circuits such as ADC.
Power the device and point it to the sun for several seconds, aligning it with the sun rays.
Observe the OLED display. The left side shows the instant UV-index measurement, and the right side displays the maximum reading taken during the session.
Note the WHO equivalent nomenclature for the measured UV-index, which is reported in the lower left part of the display (LOW, MODERATE, HIGH, VERY HIGH, EXTREME).
Calibrate the battery voltage reading using a multimeter. Measure the 5V on the Arduino from the regulator and input this value into the provided sketch.
Download and upload the provided Arduino code to the Arduino Nano.
Design or acquire an enclosure case for the project. A custom-designed case is recommended for optimal size and battery mounting.
